skill.name: plan-feature
skill.description: Plan a new feature with analysis, design, and implementation steps. Use when the user asks to plan a feature or run /plan-feature.
skill.summary: Plan a new feature with analysis, design, and implementation steps. Use when the user asks to plan a...
skill.author: DavidOpDeBeeck

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown instructions for feature planning workflows. No network, filesystem beyond project scope, or command execution capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Plan new features with structured analysis and design
content.value_statement: Software teams need structured approaches to plan new features, but manually gathering requirements and designing architecture takes significant time. This skill provides a systematic workflow for analyzing requirements, exploring existing codebase patterns, and creating actionable implementation plans saved to persistent markdown files.
actual_capabilities: Gather feature requirements through clarifying questions
Analyze existing codebase for patterns and integration points
Design solution across backend, frontend, and cross-cutting concerns
Create ordered implementation tasks with dependencies
Save plans to .claude/plans/ directory as markdown files
Present design decisions and wait for user approval
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files without user approval
Does not access external services or APIs
Does not generate tests or implementation code directly
Does not perform build or deployment operations

use_cases.title: Design Feature Architecture
use_cases.description: Analyze codebase structure and design clean architectural solutions before implementation begins

use_cases.title: Break Down Features
use_cases.description: Convert high-level feature requests into atomic, testable tasks ordered by dependencies

use_cases.title: Document Technical Plans
use_cases.description: Create persistent markdown plans that capture requirements, design decisions, and implementation roadmap

prompt_templates.title: Complex Feature Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to plan a complex feature. Ask me clarifying questions to understand the requirements first.

prompt_templates.title: Feature Extension
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan how to extend the existing [feature name] with [new capability]. Analyze the current implementation first.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Feature Scoping
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /plan-feature to create an implementation plan for: [feature name]. Focus on affected modules and key tasks.

output_examples.input: Plan a feature to add custom voting decks
output: Key decisions: Store decks at lobby level, provide preset templates
Implementation tasks: 1) Add Deck value object 2) Add CreateCustomDeckCommand 3) Implement deck storage 4) Create UI component 5) Add tests

best_practices: Start with clear feature names and acceptance criteria before invoking the skill
Review the generated plan and provide feedback before implementation begins
Use the saved markdown plans as reference documentation for future maintenance
anti_patterns: Invoking the skill without first defining the feature scope or goal
Skipping clarifying questions when requirements are ambiguous
Proceeding to implementation without user approval of the plan

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses TodoWrite for task lists and file writing capabilities.

faq.question: How detailed are the implementation tasks?
faq.answer: Tasks are atomic and testable, broken down by module and layer with clear ordering based on dependencies.

faq.question: Can I customize the output format?
faq.answer: The skill follows a standard markdown template. You can request specific sections or formatting in your prompt.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill. It only reads project files for analysis and writes plans to your local .claude/plans/ directory.

faq.question: Why is my plan not being saved?
faq.answer: Ensure you have permission to write to the .claude/plans/ directory. The skill requires explicit user approval before writing files.

faq.question: How is this different from just asking Claude?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a systematic planning methodology including requirements gathering, codebase analysis, and structured task breakdown.
